item.title: Al-Arafah Islami Bank opens training program on leadership and communication skills
item.description: A two-day training course on ‘Connect, Influence, Grow: Leadership, Communication and Interpersonal Excellence’ has begun at the Bank’s Training Institute, according to a press release. Managing Director and CEO of the bank Mohd. Rafat Ullah Khan inaugurated the training workshop

item.title: IGP Baharul dismisses resignation rumours
item.description: Inspector General of Police Baharul Alam has dismissed reports that he is preparing to resign, amid political transition following the general election. Baharul on Sunday afternoon said succinctly: “No, nothing like that has happened.” Speculation about his future surfaced two days af

item.title: SAARC Journalist Forum felicitates Tarique Rahman on BNP’s electoral victory
item.description: The Bangladesh Chapter of the SAARC Journalist Forum (SJF) has congratulated Chairman of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) Tarique Rahman on the party’s sweeping victory in the country’s 13th parliamentary election held on Thursday. In a joint statement, SJF Bangladesh Chapter Pre

item.title: After meeting Jamaat Ameer, Tarique meets NCP chief Nahid
item.description: BNP Chairman Tarique Rahman on Sunday night paid a courtesy call on National Citizen Party (NCP) Convener Nahid Islam, shortly after holding a meeting with Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami Ameer Shafiqur Rahman. Tarique reached Nahid’s residence in the capital’s Bailey Road area around 8:30p

item.title: Tarique assures Jamaat chief of protection for opposition activists
item.description: Bangladesh’s prime minister-in-waiting, Tarique Rahman, has assured the leader of Jamaat-e-Islami that he has instructed party members to protect minority communities and opposition activists amid concerns over post-election reprisals. Rahman, the chairman of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party

item.title: Army to return to barracks after new govt’s oath: Waker-Uz-Zaman
item.description: Chief of Army Staff General Waker-Uz-Zaman on Sunday said the Army will return to barracks once the newly elected government assumes office. He, however, said a portion of the Army will remain deployed in the field to assist in maintaining law and order until the police regain full control of the

item.title: EC: Take complaints to High Court
item.description: Election Commissioner Anwarul Islam Sarker has dismissed allegations of “undue haste” over the publication of the official gazette following the recent general election. He said the gazette listing the names of elected candidates was issued in due course after the announcement of unoff

item.title: No handshake as Pakistan elect to field against India
item.description: Pakistan’s Salman Agha chose to field after winning the toss against India but there was no handshake between the captains before the Twenty20 World Cup Group A blockbuster on Sunday. The match between the bitter rivals went ahead after Pakistan earlier reversed their decision to boycott the

item.title: New Delhi Press Minister Faisal Mahmud’s appointment terminated
item.description: The interim government has terminated the appointment of Faisal Mahmud as press minister at Bangladesh’s High Commission in New Delhi, seven and a half months before the end of his tenure. A notification from the Ministry of Public Administration on Sunday said: “The remaining tenure o

item.title: Trade pact or template for control over Bangladesh?
item.description: The cloak of secrecy has finally been lifted. The non-disclosure agreement that kept the Bangladesh-US "reciprocal tariff" deal hidden from public scrutiny has been pulled back, and Bangladeshis can now see what was negotiated in their name. On first reading, this does not look like an agreement be

item.title: Stocks see big jump at opening
item.description: Stocks saw a big jump at opening on Sunday, the first day after the 13th parliamentary election, as investors' confidence boosted and bargain hunters favoured taking positions in potentially lucrative shares amid renewed optimism. The market opened high, aided by the price appreciation of particul

item.title: A gender-biased election system!
item.description: When out of 85 women contestants only seven are elected in the just concluded parliamentary polls, the message it gives is not at all savoury. Of the seven, six are from the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) and the rest one contested as an independent candidate. Yet there is a twist to the tale b
